metadata.title: CVE-2017-5096 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement during navigation between different schemesin Google Chrome prior to 60.0.3112.78 for Android allowed a remoteattacker to perform cross origin content download via a crafted HTML page,related to intents.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.14.04.1190
chromium-browser-l10n - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.14.04.1190
chromium-chromedriver - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.14.04.1190
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.14.04.1190
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.14.04.1190
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.14.04.1190').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
